fi.lyma.minesweeper.logic

Class Minefield

  • java.lang.Object
    • fi.lyma.minesweeper.logic.Minefield

  • public class Minefield
extends Object
    Representation of the minefield. Minefield class is responsible for initializing the field, opening/flagging tiles and getting information about the state of the field

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Minefield(GameMode gameMode, Random random)
      Constructs the Minefield to the settings provided by gameMode.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      boolean allEmptyTilesAreOpen()
      Returns whether all the tiles in the minefield that don't contain a bomb are opened.
      List<ImmutableTile> getAdjacentClosedNonFlaggedTiles(Vector2D<Integer> location)
      Returns list of the adjacent squares around specified location that are closed and not flagged.
      GameMode getGameMode()
      Returns the GameMode that is used currently.
      int getNumberOfTilesFlagged()
      Returns number of flagged tiles in the minefield.
      ImmutableTile getTile(Vector2D<Integer> location)
      Returns Tile in specified location as ImmutableTile.
      void placeMines(Vector2D<Integer> startingLocation)
      Places the mines to the minefield so that there are no mines in startingLocation or it's adjacent squares.
      void revealAllTiles()
      Reveals all the tiles in the minefield.
      void tryFlaggingTile(Vector2D<Integer> location)
      Tries to toggle flag/question tile in specified location.
      boolean tryOpeningTile(Vector2D<Integer> location)
      Tries to reveal a tile in the minefield in specified location.
      boolean tryQuickOpening(Vector2D<Integer> location)
      Alternative way for opening tiles that can be only used on already opened tile.

    • Constructor Detail

      • Minefield

        public Minefield(GameMode gameMode,
                 Random random)
        Constructs the Minefield to the settings provided by gameMode.
        Parameters:
        gameMode - Provides settings to the field
        random - Random object that is used to decide the locations of the mines
        See Also:
        GameMode

    • Method Detail

      • tryOpeningTile

        public boolean tryOpeningTile(Vector2D<Integer> location)
        Tries to reveal a tile in the minefield in specified location. Flagged and open tiles are ignored. Locations outside the bounds are ignored.
        Parameters:
        location - Location of the tile that is tried to be opened
        Returns:
        True if tile was a mine and not flagged (i.e. game should end), otherwise false
        Throws:
        IllegalStateException - if placeMines(Vector2D) has not been called first

      • tryFlaggingTile

        public void tryFlaggingTile(Vector2D<Integer> location)
        Tries to toggle flag/question tile in specified location. Tile can be only flagged if it's closed. Toggle rotation follows FLAG -> QUESTION -> CLOSED -> FLAG. Number of flags cannot exceed the number of bombs in the minefield.
        Parameters:
        location - Location of the tile that is tried to be flagged.

      • getTile

        public ImmutableTile getTile(Vector2D<Integer> location)
        Returns Tile in specified location as ImmutableTile.
        Parameters:
        location - of the tile
        Returns:
        Tile as ImmutableTile or null if called outside the bounds

      • placeMines

        public void placeMines(Vector2D<Integer> startingLocation)
        Places the mines to the minefield so that there are no mines in startingLocation or it's adjacent squares.
        Parameters:
        startingLocation - Starting location i.e. first opened tile

      • getAdjacentClosedNonFlaggedTiles

        public List<ImmutableTile> getAdjacentClosedNonFlaggedTiles(Vector2D<Integer> location)
        Returns list of the adjacent squares around specified location that are closed and not flagged.
        Parameters:
        location - Location that specifies the adjacent tiles
        Returns:
        List of the adjacent tiles

      • revealAllTiles

        public void revealAllTiles()
        Reveals all the tiles in the minefield.

      • allEmptyTilesAreOpen

        public boolean allEmptyTilesAreOpen()
        Returns whether all the tiles in the minefield that don't contain a bomb are opened.
        Returns:
        True if all non-mine tiles are open, otherwise false

      • getNumberOfTilesFlagged

        public int getNumberOfTilesFlagged()
        Returns number of flagged tiles in the minefield.
        Returns:
        Number of flags in the minefield

      • tryQuickOpening

        public boolean tryQuickOpening(Vector2D<Integer> location)
        Alternative way for opening tiles that can be only used on already opened tile. Opens all the adjacent tiles if number of flags surrounding the tile equals the number of bombs around that tile. Does nothing when called on a tile location outside the bounds.
        Parameters:
        location - that's adjacent squares are tried to be opened
        Returns:
        True if any of the adjacent tiles was a mine and not flagged (i.e. game should end), otherwise false

      • getGameMode

        public GameMode getGameMode()
        Returns the GameMode that is used currently.
        Returns:
        Currently used GameMode
